metadata.changelog: Added ephemeral-test-environments practice (maturity level 2) as a dependency of continuous-integration, depending on test-data-management and infrastructure-automation. Added maturityLevel field to all practices. Added quality-gates and cycle-time-tracking practices. Updated deterministic-tests definition to emphasize reliable reporting of system status and process for handling unreliable tests. Updated evolutionary-coding definition to emphasize backward-compatible changes over refactoring. Removed all dependencies from deterministic-tests (foundational practice). Removed redundant test-data-management dependencies from integration-testing and performance-testing (inherited via test-environment).
metadata.description: Hierarchical data structure for Continuous Delivery practices and their dependencies

practices.description: Governance and lifecycle management of APIs including versioning, documentation, security, and monitoring.
practices.name: API Management

practices.description: The automated pipeline is the only path to production, validating every change through build, test, and deployment stages.
practices.name: Application Pipeline

practices.description: Central storage for versioned build artifacts, ensuring traceability and enabling artifact promotion across environments.
practices.name: Artifact Repository

benefits: Confidence in refactoring with comprehensive acceptance coverage
Implementation guided by concrete acceptance criteria
Prevention of scope creep through clear boundaries
Verification that features meet business requirements
practices.description: Development approach where acceptance tests are written before implementation, derived from BDD scenarios, ensuring the system meets business requirements and user expectations.
practices.name: Acceptance Test-Driven Development (ATDD
requirements: BDD scenarios to guide acceptance test creation
Clear definition of done based on passing acceptance tests
Fast feedback from acceptance test runs
Tests focus on user-visible behavior, not implementation details

practices.description: Automatically generating and managing semantic version numbers for build artifacts based on commits.
practices.name: Automated Artifact Versioning

practices.description: Database schema and data changes are automated and applied through CI/CD pipeline with version control.
practices.name: Automated DB Changes

practices.description: Infrastructure and environments created automatically through code (IaC) on-demand.
practices.name: Automated Environment Provisioning

practices.description: Comprehensive automated test suite that runs on every code change to ensure quality and catch regressions.
practices.name: Automated Testing
requirements: Fast feedback (< 10 minutes for unit tests)

benefits: Shared understanding between technical and business teams
practices.description: Define software behavior using a structured, human-readable DSL that serves as executable specifications and living documentation.
practices.name: Behavior-Driven Development (BDD)
requirements: Include explicit data values in scenarios
Scenarios are defined in a collaborative process with product, quality, and development points of view
Scenarios focus on behavior and interactions, not implementation
Scenarios relate to a single feature

benefits: Easy onboarding for new team members
Reduced human error in build process
practices.description: Comprehensive automated build process in CI/CD pipeline that compiles, packages, tests, and validates code without manual intervention.
practices.name: Build Automation
requirements: Fail fast on errors with clear messages

practices.description: Every code commit triggers an automated build and test cycle to provide immediate feedback.
practices.name: Build on Commit
requirements: Protected trunk branch requiring passing builds

practices.description: Automated testing and validation to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, industry standards, and organizational policies.
practices.name: Compliance Testing
requirements: Compliance test suite in CI/CD pipeline

practices.description: Clear accountability for each component with a designated team responsible for its entire lifecycle.
practices.name: Component Ownership

practices.description: Manage application configuration separately from code, versioned and deployed alongside artifacts.
practices.name: Application Configuration Management

practices.description: Continuous delivery improves both delivery performance and quality, and also helps improve culture and reduce burnout and deployment pain.
practices.name: Continuous Delivery
requirements: Application pipeline is the only path to production
Stop feature work when pipeline fails

practices.description: Integrate code changes frequently to detect integration issues early and maintain a working mainline.
practices.name: Continuous Integration
requirements: Automated testing before merging to trunk
Automatically test work with other work on merge
Ensure new work doesn't break existing work
Integrate work to trunk at least daily
Stop feature work when build fails

benefits: Higher confidence in changes and releases
practices.description: Testing throughout the development lifecycle with automated feedback at every stage of the pipeline plus continuous exploration and validation of look and feel.
practices.name: Continuous Testing

practices.description: Testing API contracts between services to ensure compatibility and prevent breaking changes.
practices.name: Contract Testing
requirements: Contract testing tools (static mocks, virtual services, etc.)
Machine readable service contract definitions (OpenAPI, RAML, GraphQL, AsyncApi, etc.)

benefits: Better alignment between business needs and technical implementation
Faster delivery through reduced handoffs and dependencies
More effective feedback loops with stakeholders
Stronger accountability and ownership of outcomes
practices.description: Highly cohesive, autonomous teams with all skills necessary to deliver business capabilities end-to-end, owning a subset of the product and working together continuously.
practices.name: Cross-Functional Product Team
requirements: Clear boundaries of team responsibility and autonomy
Team has authority to make decisions within their scope
Team has direct access to stakeholders and users
Team includes all necessary roles: developers, testers, UX, product owner
Team operates what they build in production
Team owns a clear subset of business capabilities or product features
Team works together in the same space (physical or virtual)

benefits: Highlights quality trends via defect rates
practices.description: Measurement and monitoring of development cycle metrics including lead time, deployment frequency, and defect arrival rates to identify bottlenecks and drive continuous improvement.
practices.name: Cycle Time Tracking
requirements: Automated collection of cycle time data from VCS and CI/CD pipeline

practices.description: Approach to database changes that supports continuous delivery and enables safe rollbacks.
practices.name: Database Migration Strategy

practices.description: Systematic approach to managing third-party libraries and dependencies.
practices.name: Dependency Management

practices.description: Automated deployment process that can push artifacts to any environment without manual steps.
practices.name: Deployment Automation

benefits: Eliminates wasted time on false failures
Teams act on test failures immediately
practices.description: Ensuring all tests produce the same result every time they run, eliminating flakiness and reliably reporting the status of the system. Unreliable tests are corrected or removed from the primary pipeline flow to maintain trust in the pipeline's decisions.
practices.name: Deterministic Tests
requirements: Clean up test data after each test
Control all inputs (time, randomness, external services)
Tests can run in parallel without interference
Tests reliably indicate actual system status
Tests that cannot be fixed are removed from primary pipeline

benefits: Improved system design from operational feedback
Reduced reliance on separate operations team
practices.description: Development teams take ownership of supporting their services in production with on-call rotations.
practices.name: Developer Driven Support
requirements: Access to production monitoring and logs

benefits: Parallel operation of old and new code
Reduced risk of introducing breaking changes
practices.description: Code evolves incrementally through backward-compatible changes that allow existing behaviors and consumers to continue working until they are ready to be replaced.
practices.name: Evolutionary Coding

practices.description: Database design evolves incrementally through small, reversible, backward-compatible changes.
practices.name: Evolutionary Database

benefits: Faster test execution with parallel environments
practices.description: Short-lived test environments created on-demand for testing and automatically destroyed after use, ensuring clean state and isolation.
practices.name: Ephemeral Test Environments
requirements: Infrastructure as Code for environment templates

practices.description: Unscripted manual testing to discover unexpected behaviors, edge cases, and usability issues.
practices.name: Exploratory Testing

practices.description: Runtime toggles that allow features to be deployed to production but not yet enabled for users.
practices.name: Feature Flags

practices.description: Testing that verifies the system behaves according to functional requirements and user expectations.
practices.name: Functional Testing

practices.description: Build artifacts once and promote the same artifact through all environments without rebuilding.
practices.name: Immutable Artifact

practices.description: Infrastructure provisioned and configured through code, enabling repeatable and consistent environments.
practices.name: Infrastructure Automation

practices.description: Testing the interactions between components, services, and external systems to validate integration points.
practices.name: Integration Testing

practices.description: Centralized logging system that aggregates logs from all application components and infrastructure.
practices.name: Logging Infrastructure

practices.description: System architecture based on loosely coupled, independently deployable modules with clear boundaries.
practices.name: Modular System

benefits: Early problem detection before user impact
practices.description: Comprehensive observability of system behavior with proactive alerting on anomalies and SLA violations.
practices.name: Monitoring and Alerting

practices.description: Ability to quickly rollback to a previous known-good version if issues are detected in production.
practices.name: On-demand Rollback

practices.description: Continuous validation of system performance under load to identify bottlenecks and ensure scalability.
practices.name: Performance Testing
requirements: Realistic test scenarios and data volumes

practices.description: Make pipeline status and results visible to the entire team to encourage collaboration and quick response to failures.
practices.name: Pipeline Visibility

practices.description: Features are ranked by business value and worked on in strict priority order to maximize ROI.
practices.name: Prioritized Features

benefits: Team alignment on what matters most
practices.description: Clearly defined, measurable product goals that align team effort and provide direction for feature prioritization.
practices.name: Product Goals

benefits: Prevents low-quality code from reaching production
Provides fast feedback on quality issues
practices.description: Automated quality thresholds enforced in the CI/CD pipeline that must be met before code can progress to the next stage, ensuring consistent quality standards.
practices.name: Quality Gates & Thresholds
requirements: Defined quality thresholds (code coverage, complexity, vulnerabilities)
Visibility of gate status to team

practices.description: Testing system behavior under failure conditions using chaos engineering principles.
practices.name: Resilience Testing

practices.description: Secure storage and access control for secrets like passwords, API keys, and certificates.
practices.name: Secret Management

practices.description: Automated security testing integrated into the CI/CD pipeline to identify vulnerabilities early.
practices.name: Security Testing

benefits: Early warning system for production issues
practices.description: Quick validation tests after deployment to ensure critical functionality works and the system is stable.
practices.name: Smoke Testing

practices.description: Automated analysis of code without executing it to find bugs, security issues, and code quality problems.
practices.name: Static Analysis

benefits: Reduces time to fix integration issues
practices.description: Team immediately stops all feature work when the build fails and prioritizes fixing the build before continuing development.
practices.name: Stop-the-Line for Failed Builds
requirements: Build status visible to all team members
Clear build failure notifications to entire team
Team commitment to stop feature work on build failure

practices.description: Comprehensive monitoring of application and infrastructure health to detect and diagnose issues quickly.
practices.name: Telemetry & Observability

practices.description: System for creating, managing, and maintaining test data that supports automated testing.
practices.name: Test Data Management

practices.description: Maintain test environments that closely mirror production to catch environment-specific issues early.
practices.name: Production-like Test Environment
requirements: Same OS and versions as production

practices.description: All developers work on a single branch (trunk/main) with short-lived feature branches that integrate frequently.
practices.name: Trunk-based Development

practices.description: Single shared backlog of work items (features, defects, maintenance) for the entire team with transparent priorities.
practices.name: Unified Team Backlog

practices.description: Testing with real users to validate user experience, interface design, and workflow efficiency.
practices.name: Usability Testing

practices.description: All code, configuration, and infrastructure definitions stored in version control system.
practices.name: Version Control

benefits: Clear change history and audit trail
practices.description: Database schemas are version controlled and changes are tracked over time with full history.
practices.name: Versioned Database
